incident_details.location: Maple Street near the intersection with Oak Avenue, outside the main entrance to the shopping center.
incident_details.description: Driving northbound on Maple, approaching a green light at Oak Avenue. Another car (dark sedan) came from Oak Avenue, trying to turn left onto Maple, and collided with the driver's side front fender. Driver swerved but could not avoid collision. Car spun, airbags deployed. Passenger Sarah hit her head; driver's neck and shoulder are stiff and painful.

third_party_info.third_party_notes: Other vehicle described as a dark sedan. Other driver's name possibly Robert or Richard. Driver has license plate and insurance information.

transcript:
Speaker 1: Thank you for calling support, I am here to help. What is your issue?
Speaker 2: Oh god, I've just been in a terrible car accident. I think I'm hurt, my neck really hurts, and my passenger... she hit her head. It was awful.
Speaker 1: I am so sorry to hear that. Please try to remain calm. This sounds like a serious incident, and we'll get you the help you need. Can I please start by getting your policy number?
Speaker 2: Uh, yes, yes. It's... let me just find it. Okay, it's 789-123-456-789.
Speaker 1: Thank you. And for verification purposes, could I please have your full name and date of birth?
Speaker 2: My name is Eleanor Vance, and my date of birth is October 15th, 1988.
Speaker 1: Thank you, Ms. Vance. And what is the best phone number or email address to reach you at currently, in case we get disconnected or need to follow up quickly?
Speaker 2: My cell is fine, it's 555-123-4567. I don't think I can check email right now.
Speaker 1: Understood. Now, Ms. Vance, can you tell me the date and approximate time this incident occurred?
Speaker 2: It happened today, just about an hour ago. So, December 10th, 2023. I'd say around 3:30 PM? Maybe closer to 3:45. It's all a bit of a blur.
Speaker 1: That's alright, we appreciate any detail you can provide. Can you tell me the exact location of the incident?
Speaker 2: Yes, it was on Maple Street, right near the intersection with Oak Avenue. Just outside the main entrance to the shopping center.
Speaker 1: Thank you. Now, Ms. Vance, in your own words, can you please give me a brief description of what happened?
Speaker 2: I was driving northbound on Maple, approaching the light at Oak, and it was green. This other car, I think it was a dark sedan, just came out of nowhere from Oak Avenue, trying to turn left onto Maple, and just slammed right into my driver's side front fender. I swerved, tried to avoid it, but they just kept coming. My car spun a bit, and the airbags went off. My passenger, Sarah, hit her head really hard on the side window. My neck feels really stiff and painful now.
Speaker 1: I'm very sorry to hear that. You mentioned you and your passenger, Sarah, sustained injuries. Have emergency services been called, or have you sought any medical attention yet?
Speaker 2: Yes, the paramedics just left with Sarah. They wanted to check her at the hospital. They checked me over too, but I refused transport because I wanted to stay with my car and call you. My neck and shoulder are really hurting though. I'll probably go get checked out after this.
Speaker 1: We strongly advise you do that immediately, Ms. Vance. Was a police report filed at the scene?
Speaker 2: Yes, the police were here. Officer Miller took down all the information. I don't have the report number right now, but he said they'd file it and I could pick it up tomorrow.
Speaker 1: Okay, we'll follow up on that. Regarding your vehicle, is it still driveable, or was it totaled in the collision?
Speaker 2: Oh no, it's definitely not driveable. The front driver's side is completely smashed in. The engine was smoking for a bit. It's sitting on the side of the road now, waiting for a tow.
Speaker 1: Understood. Lastly, Ms. Vance, you mentioned another vehicle was involved. Do you have any contact information for the other driver, or how many other people were in their vehicle?
Speaker 2: It was just one other driver. I think his name was Robert, or Richard? I have his license plate number written down somewhere, and his insurance information. I didn't get a phone number for him though.
Speaker 1: That's perfectly fine, the license plate and insurance details will be very helpful. Ms. Vance, based on the severity of the injuries reported and the nature of the incident, this is considered a high-exposure claim. We will be immediately assigning a dedicated Bodily Injury Adjuster and potentially legal counsel to your case. They will contact you shortly to discuss next steps regarding your medical care, vehicle damage, and any other related issues. For your records, your claim number for this incident is **AX-KL-BH-RT**.
Speaker 2: Okay, AX-KL-BH-RT. Thank you. What should I do now?
Speaker 1: Please, Ms. Vance, get yourself to a medical facility immediately to have your injuries assessed. We will handle contacting the tow company, the police department for the report, and the other party's insurance. Your assigned adjuster will reach out to you within the next few hours to guide you through the process. Please keep all medical records and receipts. Do you have any other questions at this moment?
Speaker 2: No, I think that covers it. Just... please make sure someone contacts Sarah's family too. She's at St. Jude's Hospital.
Speaker 1: We will ensure that all necessary parties are contacted and supported. Please focus on your recovery. We'll be in touch very soon.
Speaker 2: Thank you.
Speaker 1: You're welcome, Ms. Vance. Please take care. Goodbye.

incident_details.location: I-95 North, just past Exit 23, near the overpass for Elm Street. In the northbound lanes.
incident_details.description: Marcus was in the middle lane when traffic slowed. The car in front braked hard, Marcus braked, but the car behind him slammed into his vehicle, pushing him into the car in front. This led to a pileup involving four or five cars.

third_party_info.third_party_notes: Details obtained from the car that hit Marcus and the car he was pushed into. Information for other involved parties was not collected due to chaos and police directing traffic.

transcript:
Speaker 1: Thank you for calling Horizon Auto Insurance, my name is Sarah. How can I assist you today?
Speaker 2: Hi Sarah, I'm calling to report an accident. It was a pretty bad one, a pileup actually. I'm a bit shaken up.
Speaker 1: I'm very sorry to hear that. Please take a deep breath. We'll get through this together. To start, could you please provide your policy number?
Speaker 2: Uh, yes. Let me just find it... Okay, it's 789-123-456-789.
Speaker 1: Thank you. And can I have your full name and date of birth for verification, please?
Speaker 2: My name is Marcus Thorne, and my date of birth is May 15th, 1988.
Speaker 1: Got it, Mr. Thorne. And what's the best phone number or email address we can reach you at?
Speaker 2: My cell is 555-123-9876. Or you can use my email, marcus.thorne@email.com. The phone is probably best right now.
Speaker 1: Excellent. Now, could you tell me the date and approximate time the incident occurred?
Speaker 2: It was earlier today, about an hour ago, maybe 3:15 PM? So, October 26th, at roughly 3:15 PM.
Speaker 1: Understood. And where exactly did this accident take place? What was the location?
Speaker 2: It was on the I-95 North, just past Exit 23, near the overpass for Elm Street. In the northbound lanes.
Speaker 1: Okay, I-95 North, past Exit 23. Can you give me a brief description of what happened, to the best of your recollection?
Speaker 2: Sure. I was in the middle lane, traffic was slowing down. Suddenly, the car in front of me braked super hard, almost to a stop. I braked too, but the car behind me didn't react in time and slammed into me. That pushed me into the car in front, and then it just... spiraled from there. There were cars hitting each other like dominoes, four or five of them in total, I think.
Speaker 1: That sounds incredibly stressful. Were there any injuries sustained by you or anyone in your vehicle? Or anyone else you're aware of?
Speaker 2: I'm pretty sore, especially my neck and back, but I don't think anything's broken. My passenger, my wife, she's also shaken up but seems okay. We declined ambulance service at the scene. I saw paramedics checking on a couple of people in the other cars, but I don't know the extent of their injuries.
Speaker 1: Thank you for that information. Was a police report filed at the scene?
Speaker 2: Yes, definitely. The state police were there for a long time. They took statements from everyone they could. I don't have the report number right now, but they were definitely on scene. Officer Miller was the one I spoke with.
Speaker 1: That's helpful, we can follow up with the state police for the report. Regarding your vehicle, Mr. Thorne, is it still drivable, or was it totaled in the accident?
Speaker 2: Oh, it's not drivable at all. The front and back are both severely damaged. It had to be towed from the scene.
Speaker 1: Understood. Lastly, you mentioned four or five cars were involved in total. Did you manage to get any contact information or insurance details from the other drivers involved?
Speaker 2: I got details from the car that hit me directly, and the one I was pushed into. But with all the chaos, and the police directing traffic, I didn't get information for everyone else. It was just too much.
Speaker 1: That's perfectly understandable, Mr. Thorne. We'll use the information you've provided and follow up with the police report to gather the remaining details. For now, I've logged all this information, and your claim number is CX-FG-89-HT.
Speaker 2: Okay, CX-FG-89-HT. Got it.
Speaker 1: That's correct. We'll arrange for an appraiser to assess your vehicle's damage as soon as possible, and a claims adjuster will be in touch within 24-48 hours to discuss the next steps, including setting up a rental car if needed and reviewing your policy coverage. Is there anything else I can assist you with at this moment?
Speaker 2: No, I think that's all for now. Thank you, Sarah.
Speaker 1: You're very welcome, Mr. Thorne. Please drive safely, and we'll be in touch shortly.
